format: C language (source code for a C module)
description: This file implements the creation, initialization, management, and shutdown of an 'Ansc Daemon Server Tcp' object. It contains functions for object lifecycle management such as creating, removing, enrolling internal objects, initializing, and shutting down the TCP server object within a networking system. The code exemplifies object-oriented practices in C, defining a structured object with associated methods and internal state.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE AnscDstoCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs and initializes an 'Ansc Daemon Server Tcp' object, setting up function pointers and internal state.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDstoRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the object by canceling ongoing operations, resetting its state, and freeing associated resources.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDstoEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolling internal objects needed by the TCP server, such as the 'sDTO patient' object.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDstoInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the TCP server object, setting its properties, function pointers, and synchronization primitives.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDstoShutdown(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Gracefully shuts down the TCP server object, freeing resources and preparing for destruction.
